histogram.name: PrefetchProxy.AfterClick.BlockUntilHeadDuration.{WasServed}.{SpeculationEagerness}
histogram.summary:
If a prefetch request has started but the head of the prefetch response has not been received yet when a navigation to a URL that matches the prefetch, then the prefetch service will block until the head of the prefetch response is received and then decide to serve or not serve the prefetch.
This histogram records the amount of time that the prefetch service blocked until the head of the prefetch response was received. This histogram is only recorded for prefetches that are {WasServed} and with an Eagerness of {SpeculationEagerness}.

histogram.name: PrefetchProxy.AfterClick.Mainframe.CookieCopyStartToInterceptorCheck
histogram.summary:
Cross-Origin prefetches requested via the Speculation Rules API are made in an isolated network context. When the prefetched link is navigated to, the cookies are copied from this isolated network context to the user's default network context.
This histogram records the time from the start of the cookie copy to when the URL interceptor trying to serve the prefetch checks the status of the cookie copy.

histogram.name: PrefetchProxy.AfterClick.Mainframe.CookieCopyTime
histogram.summary:
Cross-Origin prefetches requested via the Speculation Rules API are made in an isolated network context. When the prefetched link is navigated to, the cookies are copied from this isolated network context to the user's default network context.
This histogram records the time required to copy cookies from the isolated network context used for a prefetch to the user's default network context after a prefetched link is navigated to.

histogram.name: PrefetchProxy.AfterClick.Mainframe.CookieReadTime
histogram.summary:
Cross-Origin prefetches requested via the Speculation Rules API are made in an isolated network context. When the prefetched link is na vigated to, the cookies are copied from this isolated network context to the user's default network context.
This histogram records the time required to read the cookies from the isolated network context used for a prefetch before being copied to the user's default network context after a prefetched link is navigated to. Note this does not include the time it takes to write the cookies to the default network context.

histogram.name: PrefetchProxy.AfterClick.Mainframe.CookieWaitTime
histogram.summary:
Records the amount of time that the navigation to a previously prefetched page was delayed because cookies had to be copied from the isolated cookie jar.
This is only the amount of time in which the cookie copy process blocks intercepting the navigation. The overall time it takes for the cookie copy process is recorded to the "PrefetchProxy.AfterClick.Mainframe.Cookie(Copy|Read|Write)Time" histograms.

histogram.name: PrefetchProxy.AfterClick.Mainframe.CookieWriteTime
histogram.summary:
Cross-Origin prefetches requested via the Speculation Rules API are made in an isolated network context. When the prefetched link is na vigated to, the cookies are copied from this isolated network context to the user's default network context.
This histogram records the time required to write cookies from the isolated network context used for a prefetch to the user's default network context after a prefetched link is navigated to. Note this does not include the time it takes to read the cookies from the isolated network context.

histogram.name: PrefetchProxy.AfterClick.RedirectChainSize
histogram.summary: The redirect chain size of a served prefetch. This histogram is recorded only for prefetches that are served for a navigation.

histogram.name: PrefetchProxy.AfterClick.WasBlockedUntilHeadWhenServing.{SpeculationEagerness}
histogram.summary:
If a prefetch request has started but the head of the prefetch response has not been received yet when a navigation to a URL that matches the prefetch, then the prefetch service will block until the head of the prefetch response is received and then decide to serve or not serve the prefetch.
This histogram records whether or not prefetch service will block or not for a prefetch. This histogram is only for prefetches with an Eagerness of {SpeculationEagerness}.

histogram.name: PrefetchProxy.AfterClick.WasFullRedirectChainServed
histogram.summary: Whether the full redirect chain of a prefetch is served (true), or just part of the redirect was served (false). This histogram is only recorded when: 1) the prefetch had at least one redirect (i.e. the redirect chain is at least 2), and 2) at least part of prefetch redirect chain is served.

histogram.name: PrefetchProxy.CanaryChecker.CacheEntryAge.{PrefetchProxyCanaryCheckerClient}
histogram.summary: How old a cached probe result was when it was used, in hours.

histogram.name: PrefetchProxy.CanaryChecker.CacheLookupResult.{PrefetchProxyCanaryCheckerClient}
histogram.summary: Records the status of canary check cache lookups. A sample is recorded every time Chrome attempts to use a resource prefetched using the prefetch proxy. Cache misses or cached failures result in filter probing the origin before the prefetched response can be used.

histogram.name: PrefetchProxy.CanaryChecker.FinalState.{PrefetchProxyCanaryCheckerClient}
histogram.summary: Records the end state of a probe just before it goes inactive. This happens when the prober succeeds, fails and has no more retries, or the delegate stops probing.

histogram.name: PrefetchProxy.CanaryChecker.GenerateCacheKey.{PrefetchProxyCanaryCheckerClient}
histogram.summary: Records the amount of time spent generating a cache key for the availability prober. In particular, this tracks how much getNetworkOperator calls might be slowing down this method. See crbug.com/1266018 for more details.

histogram.name: PrefetchProxy.CanaryChecker.NetError.{PrefetchProxyCanaryCheckerClient}
histogram.summary: Records the net error of a completed or timed out probe. Note that if a HTTP response does not occur within the probe's TTL, when a sample will also be added to the ERR_TIMED_OUT bucket.

histogram.name: PrefetchProxy.CanaryChecker.NumAttemptsBeforeSuccess.{PrefetchProxyCanaryCheckerClient}
histogram.summary: Records the number of attempts that are made to achieve a successful canary check. This is recorded every time we make a canary check and the result is a success. In particular, this means this is no recorded when a result was already cached or when the check attempt fails after exhausting its retries. This metric is 1-based so if a probe succeeds the first time, a sample of 1 will be recorded.

histogram.name: PrefetchProxy.CanaryChecker.TimeUntilFailure.{PrefetchProxyCanaryCheckerClient}
histogram.summary: Records the amount of time spent working on a single probe attempt to get to a failed state. Recorded every time a probe fails.

histogram.name: PrefetchProxy.CanaryChecker.TimeUntilSuccess.{PrefetchProxyCanaryCheckerClient}
histogram.summary: Records the amount of time spent working on a single probe attempt to get to a successful state. Recorded every time a probe succeeds.

histogram.name: PrefetchProxy.Prefetch.ExistingPrefetchWithMatchingURL
histogram.summary: Records whether or not there was an existing prefetch with a matching URL from a different referring document when a new prefetch is requested. This is recorded everytime a prefetch is requested.

histogram.name: PrefetchProxy.Prefetch.Mainframe.BodyLength
histogram.summary: Records the response body length as cached in memory encountered when isolated prefetching a mainframe HTML resource from the Google Search Result Page. Recorded for non-network error prefetches only.

histogram.name: PrefetchProxy.Prefetch.Mainframe.ConnectTime
histogram.summary: Records the time taken to establish a socket connection when isolated prefetching a mainframe HTML resource from the Google Search Result Page. Recorded for non-network error prefetches only.

histogram.name: PrefetchProxy.Prefetch.Mainframe.CookiesToCopy
histogram.summary: Records the number of cookies that needed to be copied from the prefetch navigation to the user's profile after a prefetched link is navigated to.

histogram.name: PrefetchProxy.Prefetch.Mainframe.NetError
histogram.summary: Records the Net Error encountered when isolated prefetching a mainframe HTML resource from the Google Search Result Page. Recorded for every completed prefetch.

histogram.name: PrefetchProxy.Prefetch.Mainframe.RespCode
histogram.summary: Records the HTTP response code encountered isolated prefetching a mainframe HTML resource from the Google Search Result Page. Recorded for non-network error prefetches only. Redirects are not included here.

histogram.name: PrefetchProxy.Prefetch.Mainframe.RetryAfter
histogram.summary: Records the duration of a Retry-After header on a 503 response to a mainframe prefetch request.

histogram.name: PrefetchProxy.Prefetch.Mainframe.TotalRedirects
histogram.summary: Records the total number of redirects encountered while doing all the prefetches on an eligible Google Search Result page. Only recorded when at least one prefetch was attempted.

histogram.name: PrefetchProxy.Prefetch.Mainframe.TotalTime
histogram.summary: Records the total time taken when isolated prefetching a mainframe HTML resource from the Google Search Result Page. Recorded for successful non-network error prefetches only.

histogram.name: PrefetchProxy.Prefetch.NumExistingEligiblePrefetchWithMatchingURL
histogram.summary: Records the number of existing eligible prefetches with a matching URL from a different referring document when a new prefetch is requested. This is only recorded for prefetches where there is at least one existing prefetch with a matching URL.

histogram.name: PrefetchProxy.Prefetch.NumExistingPrefetchWithMatchingURL
histogram.summary: Records the number of existing prefetches with a matching URL from a different referring document when a new prefetch is requested. This is recorded everytime a prefetch is requested.

histogram.name: PrefetchProxy.Prefetch.NumExistingPrefetchWithMatchingURLAndReferrer
histogram.summary: Records the number of existing prefetches with a matching referring URL and matching prefetch URL from a different referring document when a new prefetch is requested. This is only recorded for prefetches where there is at least one existing prefetch with a matching URL.

histogram.name: PrefetchProxy.Prefetch.NumExistingPrefetchWithMatchingURLAndRenderFrameHost
histogram.summary: Records the number of existing prefetches with a matching referring render frame host and matching prefetch URL from a different referring document when a new prefetch is requested. This case can occur if and only if there was a same origin navigation that re-used the same render frame host and both pages requested to prefetch the same URL. This is only recorded for prefetches where there is at least one existing prefetch with a matching URL.

histogram.name: PrefetchProxy.Prefetch.NumExistingServablePrefetchWithMatchingURL
histogram.summary: Records the number of existing prefetches with a successfully completed prefetched responses and matching URL from a different referring document when a new prefetch is requested. This is only recorded for prefetches where there is at least one existing prefetch with a matching URL.

histogram.name: PrefetchProxy.Prefetch.RedirectChainSize
histogram.summary: The redirect chain size of a prefetch. This histogram is recorded once for each prefetch.

histogram.name: PrefetchProxy.Prefetch.StreamingURLLoaderFinalStatus
histogram.summary:
Records the final status of the PrefetchStreamingURLLoader used to request the prefetch.
This is recorded once for each prefetch that is requested using a streaming URL loader. It is recorded when the streaming URL loader is deleted which can be when: 1) the URL loader is canceled, 2) the URL loader completed serving the prefetch, or 3) the prefetch was deleted and not used.

histogram.name: PrefetchProxy.Proxy.Fallback.NetError
histogram.summary: Records the Net Error encountered when Chrome did a fallback from the prefetch proxy. Recorded only on fallbacks.

histogram.name: PrefetchProxy.Proxy.RespCode
histogram.summary: Records the HTTP response code encountered when connecting to the prefetch proxy CONNECT tunnel. Recorded every time Chrome gets CONNECT tunnel response headers.

histogram.name: PrefetchProxy.Redirect.NetworkContextStateTransition
histogram.summary: The network context transition required to handle a redirect while prefetching. Prefetches require an isolated network context if user data cannot be included in the prefetch. Otherwise the prefetch is made in the default network context. This histogram is recorded for every redirect.

histogram.name: PrefetchProxy.Redirect.Result
histogram.summary: The result of receiving a redirect while prefetching. This histogram is recorded for every redirect.

histogram.name: PrefetchProxy.SpareRenderer.CountStartedOnSRP
histogram.summary: Records the number of spare renderers that were attempted to be started on the SRP, when the feature param is enabled.

histogram.name: PrefetchProxy.WasPrefetchTypeStateChangeValid
histogram.summary:
Records whether a pretch type change was or was not supported by the PrefetchProxy code. A page can change the speculation rule for a given prefetch, but not all possible changes are currently supported. If the type change is not supported then the prefetch retains its initial type.
This histogram is recorded each time the type of a prefetch is attempted to be changed.
